metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2708 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in graph_xport.php in Cacti 0.8.7g, 0.8.8b, and earlier allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the (1) graph_start, (2) graph_end, (3) graph_height, (4) graph_width, (5) graph_nolegend, (6) print_source, (7) local_graph_id, or (8) rra_id parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8b+dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8b+dfsg-5').
